intro: Camassia walpolei, commonly known as the White Camas, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and prairies, preferring well-drained soils. Camassia walpolei is a perennial herb that produces a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. It plays an important ecological role in supporting pollinators and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
